p: According to the latest reports, epidemiological situation of rubella in most EU countries is favourable. In 2017, 11 European countries reported 696 rubella cases, which represented a marked decrease from 1,264 and 2,161 cases reported in 2016 and 2015, respectively. During 2017, in the territory of 17 European countries there were no rubella cases. The highest number of cases was reported in Poland (496, where the last epidemic was registered), Germany (73), Italy (67), and Austria (39) [ 4]. In 2016, six cases of CRS were reported in 42 European countries which keep records and report this syndrome [ 14].
